snippet: An investigator says an ill-chosen part contributed to the extended shutdown of the rail service in September.
abstract: Metropolitan Transportation Authority's inspector general concludes that when the Long Island Rail Road was paralyzed for nearly 12 hours after a lightning storm in September 2011, human error factored in; reports that workers installing a $56 million state-of-the-art signal system made improper modifications to parts that allowed the lightning surge to enter the system.
lead_paragraph: An investigator says an ill-chosen part contributed to the extended shutdown of the rail service in September.

headline.seo: L.I.R.R. Workers’ Error Is Cited in Shutdown Last Fall
headline.main: Lightning That Halted L.I.R.R. Got Help From Workers’ Error, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Lightning That Halted L.I.R.R. Got Help From Workers’ Error, Report Says
